unnormalised: So, I'm planning a trip to Vaishno Devi soon and was wondering what's the best way to get there. I've heard a lot of people take the train to Jammu Tawi, but is that really the most convenient option? I'm travelling with my family, including my 70-year-old grandmother, so comfort is a priority. Also, any tips on booking the yatra registration online? Last time I checked, the website seemed a bit confusing, and I don’t want to rely on touts near the station.

unnormalised: From Jammu Tawi, you can take a pre-paid taxi or a bus to Katra, which is about 50 km away. Taxis usually charge around Rs. 1500-2000, depending on the season. Alternatively, you can also book a helicopter ride directly to Sanjichhat, which is closer to the Bhawan, but that can be quite expensive, around ₹2500-3000 per person. Just remember to book well in advance, especially during peak season like Navratri, because slots fill up fast.
normalised: From Jammu Tawi, you can take a pre-paid taxi or a bus to Katra, which is about fifty kilometer away. Taxis usually charge around rupee one thousand five hundred to two thousand, depending on the season. Alternatively, you can also book a helicopter ride directly to Sanjichhat, which is closer to the Bhawan, but that can be quite expensive, around rupee two thousand five hundred to three thousand per person. Just remember to book well in advance, especially during peak season like Navratri, because slots fill up fast.

unnormalised: For the yatra registration, try to book it online at least 1 month in advance on the official Shrine Board website (maavaishnodevi.org). Carry a printout of your registration slip and a valid ID proof like Aadhaar card with you. Also, consider hiring a porter (pithu) for your grandmother to make the trek easier. They usually charge around Rs. 800-1200, depending on the weight and distance. Have a safe and blessed yatra!
